resources.string: Average sensor values for smoother results?
Set height of device\'s viewpoint when measuring.

Angulo needs to know the height above the floor at which the device (the camera, to be precise) is held. Use the form below to enter the height in metres, or let Angulo measure it by dropping the device (on a suitably soft floor!) and measuring the time.
Drop the device on a soft floor...
See also the webpage for more details.
To measure an angle (slope or inclination), simply point the device into one direction, press Set, and point it into the other direction.
Then the rotation angle relative to gravity (down) and magnetic field (towards magnetic pole) is displayed. The green number is a combined, usually more accurate angle.
For easy reading, you can also Freeze (and later Unfreeze). Level sets the reference direction to one of the principal axes of the device instead, so that it can be used as water-level.
Point the camera focus towards a target on the floor, and the distance to it will be calculated from the angle the device has with respect to the direction of gravity.

Note that in order to get correct results, there must not be an inclination of the floor towards the target! Also ensure that you configure the height at which the device (the camera, to be precise) is held correctly.

The distance displayed is the distance between the device\'s projection onto the floor and the target. If you think of the point where you are standing on the floor, consider also the distance the device is held in front of your body!
